ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc33:0.5_0: The training rule on eating food
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc33:1.1_0: At one time the Buddha was staying near Vesālī in the hall with the peaked roof in the Great Wood.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc33:1.2_0: At that time in Vesālī people had arranged a succession of fine meals.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc33:1.3_0: And a certain poor worker thought, “This must be an important matter, in that these people prepare a meal.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc33:1.3_1: I too should make an offering of food.”
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc33:1.4_0: So that poor worker went to see,
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc33:1.4_1: and after approaching he said this to the Sangha of monks headed by the Buddha,
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc33:1.6_0: Because Kira also had faith and confidence,
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc33:1.7_0: he gave the worker his salary and much extra.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc33:1.8_0: Then that poor worker went to the Fortunate One,
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc33:1.8_2: and told him what was happening, adding,
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc33:1.9_0: “Venerable Sir, please accept a meal from me tomorrow together with the Sangha of monks.”
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc33:1.11_0: “Sir, may the Sangha of monks be fully ordained!
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc33:1.12_0: I’ve prepared much jujube and also drinks mixed with jujube.”
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc33:1.13_0: The Buddha consented by remaining silent.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc33:1.14_0: The worker got up from his seat, circumambulated the Buddha with his right side toward him, and left.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc33:1.15_0: The monks heard that a poor worker had invited the Sangha of monks headed by the Buddha for a meal on the following day, complete with drinks mixed with jujube.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc33:1.16_0: And so they ate in the morning after walking for alms.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc33:1.17_0: When people heard that a poor worker had invited the Sangha of monks headed by the Buddha for the meal,
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc33:1.17_1: Because they had much food of various kinds.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc33:1.18_0: The following morning that worker prepared his food, and then had the Buddha informed “It’s time, Sir, the meal is ready.”
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc33:1.19_0: Then the Buddha robed up in the morning and, taking his bowl and robe, went to the home of that worker.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc33:1.19_1: and after approaching he sat down on the prepared seat, together with the Community of monks.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc33:1.20_0: The worker served the monks, but they kept saying,
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc33:1.22_0: “Sir, don’t say that poor worker than serves a little works.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc33:1.23_0: I’ve prepared much food of various kinds.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc33:1.25_0: “We’re not accepting so little because of that,
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc33:1.26_0: but because we ate in the morning after walking for alms.”
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc33:1.27_0: That poor worker complained and criticized them,
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc33:1.28_0: “How can the venerables eat elsewhere when invited by me?
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc33:1.29_0: Am I not able to give as much as they need?”
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc33:1.30_0: The monks heard the complaints of that worker,
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc33:1.31_0: The monks of few desires complained and criticized Udāyī,
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc33:1.32_0: “How can those monks eat elsewhere when invited for a meal?” ...
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc33:1.33_0: “Is it true, monks, that monks did this?”
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc33:1.36_0: “... How can those foolish men eat elsewhere when invited for a meal?
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc33:1.37_0: This won’t give rise to confidence in those without it ...”
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc33:1.38_0: “And, monks, this training rule should be recited like this:
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc33:1.39.1_0: ‘If a monk eats a meal before another, he commits an offense entailing confession.’”
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc33:1.40_0: In this way the Buddha laid down this training rule for the monks.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc33:2.1_0: At one time a monk was ill.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc33:2.2_0: Another monk took some almsfood, went to that monk,
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc33:2.2_1: and after approaching he said to a monk, “Will you?”
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc33:2.4_0: But that almsfood only arrived after midday, and that monk did not eat as much as he had intended.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc33:2.6_0: After giving a teaching, the Buddha addressed the monks:
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc33:2.7_0: “Monks, I allow a sick monk to eat a meal before another.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc33:2.8_0: “And, monks, this training rule should be recited like this:
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc33:2.9.1_0: ‘If a monk eats a meal before another, except on an appropriate occasion, he commits an offense entailing confession.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc33:2.10_0: This is the appropriate occasion: he is sick.’”
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc33:2.11_0: In this way the Buddha laid down this training rule for the monks.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc33:3.1_0: Soon afterwards, during the robe-giving season, people prepared a meal together with robe-cloth and then invited the monks, “We wish to offer you a meal and give you robe-cloth.”
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc33:3.2_0: Knowing that the Buddha had prohibited eating meals in a group and being afraid of wrongdoing, they did not accept.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc33:3.3_0: As a result they only obtained a small amount of robe-cloth.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc33:3.4_0: They told the Buddha. Soon afterwards he had the Sangha gathered and questioned Devadatta:
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc33:3.5_0: “Monks, I allow you to eat a meal before another during the robe-giving season.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc33:3.6_0: “And, monks, this training rule should be recited like this:
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc33:3.7.1_0: ‘If a monk eats a meal before another, except on an appropriate occasion, he commits an offense entailing confession.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc33:3.8_0: These are the appropriate occasions: he is sick; it is the robe-giving season.’”
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc33:3.9_0: In this way the Buddha laid down this training rule for the monks.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc33:3.10.1_0: Soon afterwards people invited monks for a meal at a time when they were making robes.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc33:3.11_0: Knowing that the Buddha had prohibited eating meals in a group and being afraid of wrongdoing, they did not accept.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc33:3.12_0: They told the Buddha. Soon afterwards he had the Sangha gathered and questioned Devadatta:
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc33:3.13_0: “Monks, I allow you to eat a meal before another at a time when you are making robes.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc33:3.14_0: “And, monks, this training rule should be recited like this:
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc33:3.15.1_0: ‘If a monk eats a meal before another, except on an appropriate occasion, he commits an offense entailing confession.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc33:3.16_0: These are the appropriate occasions: he is sick; it is the robe-giving season.’”
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc33:3.17_0: In this way the Buddha laid down this training rule for the monks.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc33:4.1_0: Soon afterwards, after robing up in the morning, the Buddha took his bowl and robe and went to a certain family with Venerable Ānanda as his attendant.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc33:4.2_0: and after going, he sat down on the prepared seat.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc33:4.2_1: Then those people gave food to Venerable Ānanda,
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc33:4.3_0: and being afraid of wrongdoing, he did not accept.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc33:4.6_0: “Well then, Ānanda, transfer that meal to someone else and then receive this.”
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc33:4.7_0: Soon afterwards the Buddha gave a teaching and addressed the monks:
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc33:4.8_0: “Monks, I allow you to eat a meal before another if you transfer the other meal to someone else.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc33:4.9_0: And, monks, this is how it should be transferred: ‘I give my expected meal to so-and-so.’”
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc33:5.1.2_0: if he has been invited to eat any of the five staple foods, and he then eats any of the five staple foods elsewhere—this is called “eats a meal before another”.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc33:5.1.3_0: Except if it is an appropriate occasion:
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc33:5.1.4_0: unless it is an appropriate occasion.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc33:5.1.6_0: if he is not able to eat as much as he needs in one sitting, he may eat a meal before another.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc33:5.1.8_0: if he has not participated in the robe-making procedure, he may eat in a group during the last month of the rainy season.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc33:5.1.8_1: If he has participated in the robe-making procedure, he may eat in a group during the five month period.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc33:5.1.9_0: It is a time of making robes:
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc33:5.1.10_0: when he is making robes, he may eat in a group.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc33:5.1.11_0: If he receives it intending to eat it, except on an appropriate occasion, he commits an offense of wrong conduct.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc33:5.1.12_0: For every mouthful, he commits an offense entailing confession.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc33:5.2.1_0: If it is a meal before another, and he perceives it as such, and he eats it, except on an appropriate occasion, he commits an offense entailing confession.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc33:5.2.2_0: If it is a meal before another, but he is unsure of it, and he eats it, except on an appropriate occasion, he commits an offense entailing confession.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc33:5.2.3_0: If it is a meal before another, but he does not perceive it as such, and he eats it, except on an appropriate occasion, he commits an offense entailing confession.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc33:5.2.4_0: If it is not a meal before another, but he perceives it as such, he commits an offense of wrong conduct.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc33:5.2.5_0: If it is not a meal before another, but he is unsure of it, he commits an offense of wrong conduct.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc33:5.2.6_0: If it is not a meal before another, and he does not perceive it as such, there is no offense.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc33:5.3.1_0: there is no offense for him.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc33:5.3.3_0: if he transfers his other meal to someone else and then eats;
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc33:5.3.4_0: if he eats the food from two or three invitational meals together;
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc33:5.3.5_0: if he eats the meals in the same order that the invitations were received;
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc33:5.3.6_0: if he is invited by a whole village and he eats anywhere in that village;
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc33:5.3.7_0: if he is invited by a whole association and he eats anywhere within that association;
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc33:5.3.8_0: if he says, “I’ll take alms food,” and he says,
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc33:5.3.10_0: * The meal offerings that are drawn,
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc33:5.3.11_0: if it is cooked with rice;
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc33:5.3.12_0: if it is on the observance day;
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc33:5.3.13_0: if it is on the day after the observance day;
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc33:5.3.14_0: if it is anything apart from the five kinds of staple food;
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc33:5.3.16_0: if he is the first offender.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc33:5.3.17_0: The third rule, the training rule on eating a meal before another, is finished.
